experience: You and Wing both know Jim Skidmore, Luma Dahlbacka, and 44 others
You both worked at Charles Schwab
You both worked at Charles Schwab from Nov 2016 to Feb 2017

●	Solution architect to Schwab.com Client Center, one of the highly-rate brokerage sites in the industry.  The sites include big web, mobile web with responsive design, and micro-ui and multiple hosting environments.  Am passionate in providing software solutions to end clients and product owners.   ●	One of 4 directors that provide technical leadership to an organization with 200+ onshore and offshore resources.  Define development standards and practices, TDD and ATDD, and CI/CD.  And define development cycle and release processes and schedule.●	Extensive knowledge and effectively leading development teams onshore, offshore, multi-sites and colocation.  Foster team efficiency and effectiveness in traditional web pages, single page application with JavaScript, mid-tier web services and API.●	Extensive experience working with product owners and business leaders, ability to effect changes across organizations and teams.●	Local governance and architectural reviews, ability to evaluate project design quickly and provide constructive feedback while enforcing standards.  Ability to evaluate 3rd party software and open source and deciding on adoption path and make proper recommendations.●	Broad and in-depth experience in Agile development and SCRUM process, also in traditional SDLC mini waterfall processes, and familiar with lean management practices.●	The organization is mainly Windows environment with C# being the main language with SQL Server, AppFabric, Oracle DB, IIS, MongoDB, Redis, and good experience in a variety of tools and packages:  JQuery, Angular, RabbitMQ, NodeJs, NPM, Gulp/Grunt, Visual Studio, Visual Code, Atlassian’s toolsets (Jira, Bitbucket, Confluence, Hipchat, Bamboo), in-house CMS system and Acquia’s Drupal, Akamai hosting, PCF (Pivotal Cloud Foundry, internal cloud), IBM AppScan security, Resharper code analysis, Visio, Splunk, Fiddler, and others.

●	Led teams to develop Schwab.com client center applications, this included design, coding, guidance to development members and others.  Applications included accounts summary, positions, gain/loss, history, balances, message center, retirement assessment, and many others.●	Line of business technical owner (LTO) of a portion of Schwab.com client center applications, technical ownership of applications, provided guideline, overall design, and made sure teams adhere to standards and framework.  Reviewed design and code, including security, performance and availability, and other implementation quality measurements. Main contact to product owners and management.●	Led development team to create CRUD services to provide preferences ability to clients, and flexibility to product owners for features toggling, decision flow, and measurement.●	Part of team that created the development and release life cycle, the desire to do CI (continuous integration) and quick to market were met with 2-week release cycle. ●	TGO reviews, local governance review of all projects and initiatives.  Proactive in taking the reviews seriously, that meant took the time to listen and understand a project team approach, reviewed documentations, before advice and constraint were given.●	The main language was Java but was transitioning to C# as an organization and also firm wide.  C# Web Forms, MVC, JavaScript, with IIS hosting in Windows Servers.

●	Part of several teams that developed complex web applications: Balances, Options Trading, Google IPO, AIP, Fixed Income, and Message Inbox on Schwab.com client center.●	Enhanced, maintained and developed Schwab.com client center online trading applications, and part of the team as the first-line call support for the online trading system.  Maintained and enhanced stocks, options, mutual funds, IPO, bonds, and CDs trading pages.  Maintained and enhanced position, history, performance, transaction status, and many other pages within the main trading system.  ●	Developed new options trading pages.●	Supported, maintained, and developed offshore online trading systems.  Supported multi-language and multi-segmented trading systems.●	Developed online internal leads system.●	The main development language were in C and Java, with XML, XSL, JSP, HTML, Perl and JavaScript in UNIX.
Developed and integrated web applications for startups and corporations.  Consulted on web application design, development, technical strategy, and multi-tiers integration.
Senior System Analyst, Web Applications Development

●	Analyzed, designed, and developed web applications.  Included roles of project lead, system analyst, and programmer.●	Responsible for building a web application to deliver claims processing justifications to external clients and internal colleagues.  The project replaced an outside vendor’s product and had a cost saving of approximately $20 million annually to our clients.  Led the design, development, and implementation of the project—in charge of specifying and scheduling of project tasks; and also ended up doing most of the programming work with the shortage of staff.  Majority of the development was in C, embedded SQL in Oracle and Ingres, JavaScript, and HTML.●	Part of a team that built and maintained corporate intranet and intranet applications:  phone list, stock quotes, timesheet, HR forms, job listing, and others with a mixture of development environments in UNIX, NT, and VMS running IISs on NT and Netscape servers on UNIX. ●	Acted as the main analyst for extending corporate applications to external clients and field personnel via web applications and VPN.  Projects included applications to display demographic information to network physicians and allowing them to make changes, customary fee querying tool deploying to clients, and querying tool for network physicians to validate contract status.●	Part of a team that built and maintained global application routines in C to support web development, maintained external corporate site, specified web development standards for the company, reviewed and recommended web development tools and technologies.

recommendations: David Wang
Business Quality Analyst | Testing Project Manager
February 21, 2017, David worked with Wing in different groups

I was a QA lead as Wing's counterpart on numerous projects at Charles Schwab.  Wing is an extremely experienced tech lead. He takes great pride in his work, and always works tirelessly in finding the best solutions to produce high profile customer-facing applications.  Every time I log in to the Schwab.com trading site, I marvel at the applications that Wing had worked on over the years. These products are so intuitive to use, yet I know they involved a great amount of cross-organizational coordination and effort. Wing is the ultimate team player. He shares knowledge with a group of junior level software developers, and engages them in the best software development process. He's very approachable, and can explain technically complicated software architecture to a non-technical audience.  I feel very lucky to have worked with Wing during my tenure at Schwab.

Joseph C. Lin, PMP, CSPO
Seasoned Agile Online Product/Project Management Professional | Web Development/Digital User Experience Expert
February 16, 2016, Wing worked with Joseph in different groups

Joseph is a great product owner.  He works very hard to prepare himself to lead the team from a product owner perspective.  He spends many, many hours before formal project kickoff.  He'd talk to designers, to get their feel for the overall design, and make his inputs known to them.  Then he'd spend many hours with tech lead/architects to understand the constraints on a system.  And obviously he works hard to understand management perspective of the product.  When he has all of those down, then would he prepare his documentations and draft user stories to present to entire team.Joseph is very hard working individual, very smart and can understand technology challenges--which as a technologist I really appreciate.
